Hi all,

I am new to jUnit4, so please forgive me these questions.
I want t=
o create a testing framework for a database system.
I use Eclipse so I want=
 to use its build-in jUnit GUI.
It allows only to execute a single testing =
class or all testing
classes found in a package or a project.

I find some =
things impossible to do.

1. I have many testing classes in different packa=
ges.
2. Each testing class may have its own @Before and @After methods.
3. =
Some things have to be done for the whole testing class once...
should it b=
e put in a class  constructor?
4. I need to create a database environment b=
efore all tests from all
clasesses are run. 
@BeforeClass seems to be calle=
d once at the beginning... but then
@AfterClass is called before other test=
 classes are run. 

It looks like, in jUnit4 all testing classes are comple=
tely separated
during testing.
Please, explain what is the philosophy of jU=
nit4 because there are so
few documents on it.

How can I create and run a =
test suite in Eclipse using its GUI?


Thanks,
KK
